law.catch_line: A person may not act as a reinsurance manager for a reinsurer without a written contract that:...

section.section:
A person may not act as a reinsurance manager for a reinsurer without a written contract that:
states the responsibilities of the reinsurance manager and the reinsurer; and
is approved by the board of directors of the reinsurer.
A reinsurance manager may not assign the contract required under this section.

text.section: At least 30 days before a reinsurer assumes or cedes business through a reinsurance manager, a copy of the contract required under this section shall be filed with the Commissioner for approval.

section.section: If the Commissioner obtains an order of liquidation, rehabilitation, reorganization, or conservation against a reinsurer, the files become the sole property of the liquidator, rehabilitator, conservator, or receiver.

text.section:
If the contract required by this section allows a sharing of interim profits by the reinsurance manager, the interim profits may not be paid until:
1 year after the end of each underwriting period for property insurance business;
5 years after the end of each underwriting period for casualty insurance business; or
a longer period that the Commissioner sets for a specific line of insurance; and
the adequacy of reserves on remaining claims is verified as provided in § 8-520(a)(3) of this subtitle.
